intro: Linaria commutata, commonly known as the common toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are opposite or whorled along the stem. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Linaria commutata is often found in disturbed soils and is considered an invasive species in some regions outside its native range.
